Class indexer.Index

  • java.lang.Object
    • indexer.Index

  • public class indexer.Index
extends java.lang.Object
    A data structure that represents an invertedIndex that stores how many times a term appears in each file along with the document id. Each invertedIndex entry points to a list of Postings.
    Since:
    09-27-2017
    Author:
    Pedro Matos, David Ferreira
    See Also:
    indexer.Posting

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      indexer.Index()
      Constructs an empty invertedIndex.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTokenOcurrence(java.lang.String token, int docID)
      Adds an occurrence of a token in a document with a certain ID to the invertedIndex.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTop10TermsOccurrences(int docID)
      Returns a List which contains the 10 terms of a invertedIndex, alphabetically ordered, with the most occurrences in a certain document.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTopFreqTerms()
      Returns a List with the 10 terms with the highest document frequency.
      void saveIndexToFile(java.lang.String fileName)
      Saves a representation of the invertedIndex in a CSV(Comma Separated Value) file.
      java.lang.String toString() 
      int vocabularySize()
      Returns the size of the invertedIndex vocabulary which corresponds to the number of terms in the invertedIndex.

    • Method Detail

      • addTokenOcurrence

        public void addTokenOcurrence(java.lang.String token,
                              int docID)
        Adds an occurrence of a token in a document with a certain ID to the invertedIndex.
        Parameters:
        token - A word/token, its occurrence will be stored in the invertedIndex.
        docID - The ID of the document where the token appeared.

      • getTop10TermsOccurrences

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTop10TermsOccurrences(int docID)
        Returns a List which contains the 10 terms of a invertedIndex, alphabetically ordered, with the most occurrences in a certain document.
        Parameters:
        docID - The ID of the document
        Returns:
        A List with the top 10 terms that have the most occurrences in a document
        See Also:
        List

      • getTopFreqTerms

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTopFreqTerms()
        Returns a List with the 10 terms with the highest document frequency.
        Returns:
        A List with the top 10 terms with higher document frequency.
        See Also:
        List

      • saveIndexToFile

        public void saveIndexToFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Saves a representation of the invertedIndex in a CSV(Comma Separated Value) file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The of the file where the invertedIndex Will the saved to.
        See Also:
        CSV

      • vocabularySize

        public int vocabularySize()
        Returns the size of the invertedIndex vocabulary which corresponds to the number of terms in the invertedIndex.
        Returns:
        The size of the vocabulary that is indexed.
